Literally ruined Twotoed's chance of losing his virginity

I have 1000+ hours in this game over on BNet.

I can safely say that I've never seen a video game franchise crash and burn so hard by consistently failing to deliver on their promises. It's astounding how inept the Overwatch team has become at simply making a competitive shooter GOOD.

If you asked me back in 2016/17 if I recommend Overwatch, i'd say yeah sure. Even as a free-to-play game, I cannot, in good conscience, recommend this game to anyone. You're wasting your time. There are more enjoyable shooter titles out there (Team Fortress 2 is still alive and kicking, and way more fun).

Overwatch was not perfect, but over the years they have refined it to be rather good. But apparently Blizzard milekd it dry, so it was no longer bringing in money.
With Overwatch 2 they did an absolute minimum in terms of adding new content. MINIMUM. But they did just enough changes to completely wreck all the balancing on first game.
When it first came out i gave it 2/10, in hopes that most of the problems will be swiftly addressed in following months. After 3 months i gave it 0/10, because i have already played original and this game was a net negative addition to franchise. Plus they barely fixed anything and added new problems. While some of the most egregious issues were somewhat addressed, like completing events being full-time-40-hours-a-week-job, most of the issues are still there. In fact with Steam release they managed to add even more crap.
Most of the issues, from absurd pricing to pisspoor rewards for actually playing, are there and are clearly not going away. Cheaters run rampant. With Steam release i now also get constant disconnects for no good reason.
And of course PVE, that was supposed be the whole point of OW2, has been released only almost a year later, locked behind paywall and will clearly be fed to wider public in bite sizes, so that they can milk it for a long time. 15 bucks at the time, every few months.
In short, they took Overwatch, a solid and interesting game, made a lot of promises(what exactly team was doing for 3 years?!?!), that they did not keep, cut off bits and pieces from original game and then released this castrated abomination as Overwatch 2. It is less, it is worse and it is also a microtransactions heaven. Because without playing money player will get absolute minimum.
Overwatch Freemium.

- you made the "sequel" on the premise of making singleplayer campaign, adding new exciting stuff  and all this shit
- because of that, you starved every sinlge fan of ov1 from any new content for years
- then you realeased this abomination of a game, changing or deleting completely many great features and again you 
   made a lot of promisies that this is made on behalf of a singleplayer campaign and that you're focusing on it
- finally you deleted lootboxes system because it's "not good for players" but in reality you saw that the free to play 
   battlepass model will make you a ton of money
- now you deleted the campaign and said that you don't have enough resources to work on campaign and multiplayer at 
   the same time xD 
- in reality you're focusing on making skins and bundles to milk your playerbase until the natural death of this once great 
   game
- your company is probably the worst downfall of all time in history of gaming (and we still have Electronic Arts xD)
   and im not even talking here about what you're doing with diablo 4, starcraft franchise, hots or WoW

I don't know when this game will die but it's probably sooner than later and i really still hope that the future holds redemption arc for you Blizzard

PS: And yes, I do think that ov porn poeople work harder than any of your employee ( especially the excecutives)

2016: Wow, OW is awesome.
2017: Nice events, probably just the beginning
2018: Same events as last year but new heroes and other content is great. Well, maybe they're preparing something big. Games still awesome.

2019: Why do we need a sequel? Anyway, more PVE sounds cool.
2020: Silence
2021: Silence
2022: Silence / Jeff left the OW team. Possible red flag?


2023: Hey, we're releasing OW2 but we scrapped a lot of the PVE content, which makes OW2 basically a crappier version of OW1.

Oh, and we're adding a Battle Pass, overpriced skins and lock new heroes behind a pay wall or stupid missions.


Thanks for ruining one of my favorite games of all time.

The first two years (and the Beta) were the most fun time I've ever had with video games.
How they can f*ck up so badly is really beyond me.
